comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: William J. Lee was a recreation supervisor for the New York City Department of Parks and Recreation. He was a big proponent of parks events like historical pageants, athletic competitions, cultural festivals, etc., to keep kids from playing in the streets or otherwise pursuing hazardous pastimes. www.nycgovparks.org/sub_about/parks_history/recreationcen...

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: With all the flags and bunting, and the late Feb date on the other picture, I'd guess this is a Washington's Birthday celebration.  Not sure what the kids in the "Indian" costumes are up to, though.
